job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Suffern, NY
pros: good benefits with union.. i dont have any other pros
cons: all travelers.. no staff at all. terrible management. more administrators than nurseas

pros: Excellent MD/provider support in ED. Team work environment for the most part. Union position so pay and benefits are decent.
cons: Relatively new management has no idea what they’re doing. No float nurses dedicated to ED when staffing is short. Management doesn’t care if the Dept is short and that there is no one to help. They just turn their back. Sometimes nurse to patient ratio very high. Have had 13 patients at one time. Inefficiency to the nth degree.

pros: 3 days on, 4 days off Union based

pros: It was fine working here. Great coworkers. Screwed up pay system as it didn’t differ between ER and actual inpatient floors. You do a lot more as a Unit Secretary in ER than inpatient.
cons: Weird management. But they have left at the time of me writing this.

review_title: Pretty good place to work and great job stability.
job_title: Materials Technician I in Suffern, NY
pros: The material technicians job is a job that has great job stability as well as flexibility that helps with my college schedule. The pay rate is very nice and I believe we also get an annual raise. Also great environment for career development and upward mobility.
cons: Some of the challenges working here may include management and coworkers being unprofessional at times, otherwise it is a great place to work. Having a great load of patience when dealing with people will really help in this job as well.

pros: This hospital offers good benefits and is good for the person who doesn’t want to commute too far for work
cons: There are some managers who are allowed to get away with murder. Departments are always understaffed and you’re forced to do more with very little.

pros: Great place to work, friendly staff, engaged admin
cons: poor orientation process, lack of resources

pros: 1199 with good benefits and no copay. Currently not fully staffed, but when it is, it’s actually a great place to work, IMO. Under new management, which, so far, has been great.
cons: Understaffed, but so is every other hospital right now. They will not hire new grads in the ER or inexperienced. They also cater to a specific group of people within the community, which isn’t right. Everyone should be treated the same when it comes to patients. This is all due to Mary Leahy, CEO.

pros: union is excellent.. pays for school
cons: extremely short staffed...always. a lot of travelers. a lot of turnover

job_title: Registered Nurse Home Care in Middletown, NY
pros: Very Good Benefits offered that’s it
cons: Paperwork, caseload, lots of managerial changes

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Nyack, NY
pros: The salary and medical benefits are very good
cons: Respiratory is short staffed every shift, quality care isn’t given to patients because you are being pulled to multiple areas. No true breaks due constant calls and always having to hold on to your beeper. Director micro manages the staff but is not available to help when needed. No per diem staff to alleviate full time staff for days off . Staff is burnt out . Administration doesn’t value the staff even after covid. Administration doesn’t listen to the needs of the staff.

job_title: Trauma Program Manager in New York, NY
pros: its in a good neighborhood only 40 mins from NYC
cons: Covid pandemic made healthcare difficult for administrators and staff

pros: Benefit, Staff/team members, shift schedule, Catholic hospital that caters to Jewish faith
cons: Management are clowns, racist, terrible pay, weak union

review_title: Used to be a good place to work
pros: The people who "work" there are some of the best people in the business. Good benefits (if you get the "hospital" benefits package). Some of the brightest and professional doctors anywhere.
cons: Management (esp. executive managment).  These are some of the dumbest individuals anywhere. This particular bunch is running, what used to be a great facility, into the ground. They are driving away physicians, alienating the community, and abusing staff. They will lie, manipulate and hide behind the christian values that the hospital was founded by. The only part worse, may be the ownership - Bon Secours, because they are the ones supporting the poor decisions this administration keeps making. Recent outsourcing of many departments, especially the rehab dept. The rehab dept will now be managed by a profit driven company (Rehab Care - see reviews at this site). However, it remains to be seen if they can even staff the dept as they have chased away ALL of the wonderful therapist (many who had worked at the hospital for greater 10 years).

pros: Pay is good. Staff is wonderful to work with they are more then happy to get your back when needed. Hours are pretty standard. The three stars are for the staff not the management.
cons: Management likes to play the blame game. As per diem there are no benefits. Empty promises. Poor stocking.  Treated like a slave.  Constantly short staffed. ( yet management complains about unhappy patients) don't waste your time going to HR.  it will fall on deaf ears.

pros: Emergency department staff are great. Manager actually listens to staff issues and helps out. Encourages education, always trying to improve.
cons: Pay is not that competitive being so close to the city but the benefits are good.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Suffern, NY
pros: Benefits are good if full time.
cons: must work weekends, holidays, long shifts

pros: Friendly co workers, pays well
cons: Very poor medical benefits- don't apply to a nursing position if your spouse needs benefits

pros: wonderful people to work with
cons: incompetent management that do not value their staff... felt very expendable

pros: Great co-workers. And Management is nice.
